feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows a discrepancy in daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll settings. The payroll-side daily wage calculator takes precedence and overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave deductions. The greyed-out display in leave policy indicates this override is intentional.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll settings can override leave policy daily wage formulas without clear visual communication
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrectly Handles Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator is not correctly accounting for leap years in its calculation logic. When calculating gratuity for an employee with service spanning 2024 (a leap year), the system counts 365 days instead of 366 days for that year, resulting in an incorrect total service period (607 days instead of 608 days) and an incorrect gratuity amount (AED 10,476.98 instead of AED 10,494.24).
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations. The system requires enhancement to automatically recognize and incorporate 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific methodologies for counting days, accounting for leap years, and applying different daily rates based on service duration.
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic requires precise understanding of service duration split and daily wage computation | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Amount Discrepancy in Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing slight variations in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The specific case showed a difference between 912 and 913 total days, impacting the final calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently managed
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration and gratuity calculations

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Days Calculation in Gratuity
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates days worked with a potential extra day (623 days instead of 622 days). Daily wage calculation uses a fixed divisor of 30 days, which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic × 12 / 365).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor discrepancy in total days
known_issues.gap_statement: Inflexible daily wage calculation method that doesn't support alternative computation formulas

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations vary monthly due to different working day counts
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a consistent method for calculating leave salary accruals across months with varying working days

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Divisor Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. This is a system design limitation where leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage formulas.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations use separate configurations with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method that consistently applies across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match traditional calendar day expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When payroll is processed earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios, especially for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This results in incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for enhanced module communication to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpredictable Deduction Calculations
known_issues.issue_explanation: The payroll system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses non-standard 30.42 day divisor instead of calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. Deductions are calculated using a global setting instead of policy-level basic salary / working days configuration.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in handling nuanced leave policy configurations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Monthly Daily Rate Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the month of leave occurrence
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Per Month Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is calculated based on a standard 26 working days per month (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in actual worked days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify leave policy formula when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Change Impact on Leave Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is updated after leave request creation

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years in Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365-day years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service gratuity benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently show amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points across all employee calculations.
limitations.impact: Inaccurate final settlement amounts for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month under monthly accrual policy, preventing mid-month leave balance inclusion in EOS
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include partial month's leave balance

limitations.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculations

limitations.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
limitations.limitation_statement: The system calculates partial years differently for service periods above 5 years, using specific day counting and divisor (365 or 366) based on leap year inclusion.
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies between manual and system calculations for end of service (EOS) benefits

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of gratuity calculation methodology for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Working Days vs Custom Days Leave Encashment Setting
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave encashment can be calculated using either 'working days' (variable monthly rate) or 'custom days' (consistent rate)
limitations.impact: Accrual calculations will differ based on selected configuration method

limitations.title: Separate Configurations for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Inconsistent salary calculations that require manual configuration alignment

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may appear different from traditional calendar-based calculations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions with payroll deductions when modifications or deletions occur.
limitations.impact: Users may experience duplicate or persistent payroll deductions that require manual intervention to remove.

limitations.title: Retroactive Recalculation Not Supported
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holidays are added after leave request processing.
limitations.impact: Potential salary deduction inaccuracies that cannot be automatically corrected

limitations.title: Custom Days Divisor for Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System calculates daily wage by dividing monthly salary by 30.42 (custom days) instead of actual calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not exactly match expected monthly salary, requiring manual reconciliation

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations must use the actual number of calendar days in a specific month, with special handling for February in leap years.
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate unpaid leave deductions based on precise calendar days

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Need for manual tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of automated salary calculation system
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Use a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking separately for each employee

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Inconsistent daily wage formula display between leave policy and payroll settings
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings intentionally configured to override leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily wage calculator configuration in payroll settings to understand actual applied formula

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service calculations show slightly lower amounts than expected
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage formula calculation (basic + allowances / 30)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Ticket was escalated to development team and resolved

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Leave balance not automatically included for mid-month departure
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Monthly accrual policy restricts leave day inclusion for incomplete months
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust leave balance in EOS section or switch to conditional daily accrual policy

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system-calculated and client-edited gratuity amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System calculates gratuity based on specific methodology, but allows manual client editing
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation methodology and confirm total service days before manual override

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences between manual and system gratuity calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses specific methodology for counting days and applying different daily rates based on total service duration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation by breaking down service period into segments (before and after 5 years), accounting for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Cumulative leave salary accrual amounts differ between months
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to use working days, which varies the daily rate based on monthly working days count
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Change leave encashment setting to 'custom days' for consistent calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatch between expected and system-calculated leave salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Different divisor configurations for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually align leave salary and salary proration daily wage configurations to use consistent divisors

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Proration is calculated based on work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify work week configuration and understand that all days marked as working will result in full month calculation

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full salary displayed for partially worked month
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation logic does not account for departure date relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on days worked (daily rate = monthly salary / 30 * days worked)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after leave request changes
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Synchronization failure between leave management and payroll systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually review and remove duplicate deductions, as system does not auto-reconcile

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect salary deduction for unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Timing mismatch between public holiday addition and leave request processing
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual deduction adjustment or reopening previous payroll cycles (not recommended)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Deduction amount differs from expected monthly salary
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses 30.42 day divisor to calculate daily wage: (Monthly Salary / 30.42) * Days of Leave
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify daily wage calculation using system's configured divisor of 30.42 days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Daily rate shows incorrect month for unpaid leave deduction
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System recalculates daily rate based on payroll processing month instead of storing original leave occurrence month rate
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: A fix was deployed to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount, avoiding recalculation

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Divisor Mismatch
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary (30 days) and salary proration (30.42 days), causing calculation discrepancies. This is a system design limitation where leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage formulas.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When payroll is processed earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Persistent Payroll Deductions After Leave Request Deletion
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes out of sync between Payroll and Time Off modules. This results in incorrect salary deduction amounts that cannot be retroactively corrected.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpredictable Deduction Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The payroll system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Displayed in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The system displays incorrect daily rate remarks for February, showing 31 days instead of 29 days (leap year), despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. Deductions are calculated using a global setting instead of policy-level basic salary / working days configuration.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Monthly Daily Rate Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Per Month Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is calculated based on a standard 26 working days per month (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Change Impact on Leave Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of 366-Day Years in Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365-day years, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days in service period calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: Pro-rated amount calculations consistently show amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimal points across all employee calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month under monthly accrual policy, preventing mid-month leave balance inclusion in EOS

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguous Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically around departure date inclusion and leap year day handling

claims_to_validate.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates partial years differently for service periods above 5 years, using specific day counting and divisor (365 or 366) based on leap year inclusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas

claims_to_validate.title: Working Days vs Custom Days Leave Encashment Setting
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave encashment can be calculated using either 'working days' (variable monthly rate) or 'custom days' (consistent rate)

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Configurations for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The Bayzat platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly for departure dates in the past, not for future departure dates

claims_to_validate.title: Incomplete Transaction Reconciliation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions with payroll deductions when modifications or deletions occur.

claims_to_validate.title: Retroactive Recalculation Not Supported
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holidays are added after leave request processing.

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations must use the actual number of calendar days in a specific month, with special handling for February in leap years.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.statement: Daily rate is calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
